intro: Chardinia cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical chardinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance. Chardinia cylindrica is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
